result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 8:35 a.m.
Clerk: Nicole.
INCLUDES: 21CF660, 21CF1456, 22CF190, 22CF599.

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Def appears in person from the MCJ, with Atty John Wallace. 

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
21CF660
COUNT 1 Strangulation and Suffocation DA>>DRI.

22CF190 
COUNT 1 Bail Jumping-Felony>>DRI.
COUNT 2 Bail Jumping-Felony>>DRI.
COUNT 3 Possession of THC>>DRI.


22CF599
COUNT 1 Bail Jumping-Felony>>DRI.
COUNT 2 Bail Jumping-Felony>>DRI.
COUNT 3 Bail Jumping-Felony>>DRI.
COUNT 4 Retail Theft-Intentionally Take (<=$500)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS

PLEA: 
21CF660
COUNT 2 Battery DA>>NO CONTEST.
COUNT 3 Disorderly Conduct DA>>NO CONTEST.

21CF1456
COUNT 1 Bail Jumping-Felony>>NO CONTEST.
COUNT 2 Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=500)>>NO CONTEST.

22CF190
COUNT 4 Possession of Methamphetamine PTAC>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation on felony counts and 2 years probation on misdemeanor counts- CONDITIONS: SAFE Program; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; no possession of dangerous weapons; Probation Review Hearings; 60 days I/S Jail and 40 hours of community service I/S for rule violations; 2 DV surcharges; DNA sample/surcharge; CC; No contact with victim K.M.P. on 21CF660.

61 days credit 21CF660.
59 days credit 21CF1456.
71 days credit 22CF190.

DATES:
PRH: 12/16/22 @ 1:15 p.m.

Adj: 8:48 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 10:50 am.

State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant is in MCJ - Atty Wallace appears on deft's behalf. 
Parties discuss cases and request plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:50 am.
Probable Cause Found

Clerk Amanda
Cases Called at 9:33 am. 
INCLUDES: 22CF599, 22CF190, 21CF1456 and 21CF660. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney John Wallace.   

Waiver of Prelim to be filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 

PLEA >> NOT GUILTY;

NEXT DATES:
PTC currently set for 10/21 at 10:50 am. 

Bond Continues; 

Adj: 9:35 am.
